page.title: 15CHILTON CANTELO CHURCH.
page.content: Chilton Cantelo Church is a wonder to look at.Henry Goodford had a beautiful mosaic floor installed by Italians.At one end of the church there are metal plaques in memory of the Goodfords.The church was adapted by the Normans when they came in 1066.Added to the west end is a late 14th century tower. 1864 Rev. Goodford rebuilt the church almost like new .The floor under the pews is original 19th century oak,the pulpit,alter,choirstands and church screen are also made of the same oak. The inside walls are made of hamstone. The only tomb in the church contains the headless body of Theophilus Broome who was killed in the Civil War in the 17th century. The body was exhumed in the late 19th century to prove this. The skull is kept in the Farm House across the road. All attempts to bury the head with the body fail.
